numlitem.para: It is verified that the malfunction is in the fuel filter bypass warning system, and
Associated fuel filter is checked for the presence of contaminants before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ FUEL CONTROL VLV IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the malfunction is in the associated fuel filter bypass warning system:
Remove and replace the fuel filter (AMM 73-11-02/401).
If the EICAS status message ENG_ FUEL FILT remains displayed after system is restored to normal configuration and 70 seconds time has elapsed, the fuel filter bypass warning system is faulty.
Prior to each departure check the fuel filter to ensure there are no contaminants:
On GE powered aircraft, check fuel filter to ensure absence of contaminants and install a new fuel filter (AMM 73-11-02/401).
